inclusion.criterion: children meeting criteria for any subtype of ADHD between the ages of 5-12 who are
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: children with a Full Scale Intelligence Quotient (I below 70 as children with IQs less than this would likely not benefit from the behavior therapy intervention
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: not in full time school or less than 5 or older than 12 years at the time of the screening visit
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: children who have a history of seizures or other neurological problems and are taking medication to prevent seizures as stimulants could worsen seizures
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: children with a history of other medical problems for whom psychostimulant treatment may involve considerable risk including cardiac arrhythmias, hypertension, Tourette's Disorder or history of severe tic exacerbations
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: children with a history of other medical problems that could impact appetite or weight such as hypothyroidism, diabetes mellitus, liver or renal disease. Also, children using prescription medication that can significantly impact appetite or weight are excluded
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: children with a childhood history or diagnosis of any of the following mental health disorders: pervasive developmental disorder, schizophrenia or other psychotic disorders, bipolar disorder, post traumatic stress disorder, major depression with serious suicidal thoughts or an eating disorder as stimulants are not safe and effective treatments for these conditions, and these diseases could affect eating habits
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: children whose Body Mass Index is very low (too light for safe use of stimulant medication) or is too high (overweight so not suitable for weight promotion treatments)
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: children allergic to milk proteins as they are in the caloric supplement (lactose intolerance okay)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: children previously treated with stimulant medications for more than 30 days as this study is focusing on children who have never used stimulant medication before
exclusion.label: met

notes: The patient is a 32-year-old obese woman who came to the clinic with weight concerns. She has sleep apnea, PCO and dissatisfaction with her body shape.
